intro: Halimus congensis, commonly known as the Congolese halimus, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweed and related species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
